item.title: TikTok will automatically label AI-generated content created on platforms like DALL·E 3
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
TikTok is starting to automatically label AI-generated content that was made on other platforms, the company announced on Thursday. With this change, if a creator posts content on TikTok that was created with a service like OpenAI’s DALL·E 3, it will automatically have an “AI-generated” label attached to it to notify viewers that it was […]

item.title: India weighs delaying caps on UPI market share in win for PhonePe, Google Pay
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
India’s mobile payments regulator is likely to extend the deadline for imposing market share caps on the popular UPI payments rail by one to two years, sources familiar with the matter told TechCrunch. The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), a special unit of the Reserve Bank of India, plans to extend the deadline for […]

item.title: Thai food delivery app Line Man Wongnai weighs IPO in Thailand, US in 2025
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description:
Line Man Wongnai, an on-demand food delivery service in Thailand, is considering an initial public offering on a Thai exchange or the U.S. in 2025.

item.title: OpenAI offers a peek behind the curtain of its AI’s secret instructions
item.dc:creator: Devin Coldewey
item.description:
Ever wonder why conversational AI like ChatGPT says “Sorry, I can’t do that” or some other polite refusal? OpenAI is offering a limited look at the reasoning behind its own models’ rules of engagement, whether it’s sticking to brand guidelines or declining to make NSFW content. Large language models (LLMs) don’t have any naturally occurring […]

item.title: US Patent and Trademark Office confirms another leak of filers’ address data
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description:
The federal government agency responsible for granting patents and trademarks is alerting thousands of filers whose private addresses were exposed following a second data spill in as many years. The U.S. Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) said in an email to affected trademark applicants this week that their private domicile address — which can include […]

item.title: Encrypted services Apple, Proton and Wire helped Spanish police identify activist
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description:
As part of an investigation into people involved in the pro-independence movement in Catalonia, the Spanish police obtained information from the encrypted services Wire and Proton, which helped the authorities identify a pseudonymous activist, according to court documents obtained by TechCrunch. Earlier this year, the Spanish police Guardia Civil sent legal requests through Swiss police […]

item.title: Match looks to Hinge as Tinder fails
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
Match Group, the company that owns several dating apps, including Tinder and Hinge, released its first-quarter earnings report on Tuesday, which shows that Tinder’s paying user base has decreased for the sixth quarter in a row. On the other hand, Hinge has seen an increase in members who are willing to pay for the app. […]

item.title: Gratitude Plus makes social networking positive, private and personal
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Private social networking is making a comeback. Gratitude Plus, a startup that aims to shift social media in a more positive direction, is expanding its wellness-focused, personal reflections journal to include support for families who want to stay in touch even when physically distant.  The startup, whose name reflects its core offering of a gratitude […]

item.title: Can AI help founders fundraise more quickly and easily?
item.dc:creator: Alex Wilhelm
item.description:
With venture totals slipping year-over-year in key markets like the United States, and concern that venture firms themselves are struggling to raise more capital, founders might be worried. After all, if private-market investment doesn’t perk up in the coming quarters, we could be on track for yet another year of declines in total startup investment […]

item.title: Google brings a variation on ‘Circle to Search’ to iPhone users
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Google has found a way to bring a variation of its clever “Circle to Search” gesture to iPhone users. The new interaction, launched in January, allows Android users to search from anywhere on their device by circling, highlighting, scribbling or tapping, making it easier to engage with Google Search from any screen. Of course, a […]

item.title: Always-on video portal lets people in NYC and Dublin interact in real time
item.dc:creator: Ron Miller
item.description:
A new sculpture going live on Wednesday in the Flatiron South Public Plaza in New York is not your typical artwork. It combines technology, sociology, anthropology and art to let people interact with one another in real time in two places. In this case, it’s between New York City and Dublin. The Portal itself is […]

item.title: TechCrunch Minute: When did iPads get as expensive as MacBooks?
item.dc:creator: Morgan Little
item.description:
Apple’s iPad event had a lot to like. New iPads with new chips and new sizes, a new Apple Pencil, and even some software updates. If you are a big fan of Apple hardware, well, it was probably a good day. Now you can get an updated and thinner iPad Pro, if that’s your jam. […]

item.title: Bye-bye bots: Altera’s game-playing AI agents get backing from Eric Schmidt
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
Autonomous, AI-based players are coming to a gaming experience near you, and a new startup, Altera, is joining the fray to build this new guard of AI agents. The company announced Wednesday that it raised $9 million in an oversubscribed seed round, co-led by First Spark Ventures (Eric Schmidt’s deep-tech fund) and Patron (the seed-stage fund […]

item.title: Google DeepMind debuts huge AlphaFold update and free proteomics-as-a-service web app
item.dc:creator: Devin Coldewey
item.description:
Google DeepMind has taken the wraps off a new version of AlphaFold, their transformative machine learning model that predicts the shape and behavior of proteins. AlphaFold 3 is not only more accurate, but predicts interactions with other biomolecules, making it a far more versatile research tool — and the company is putting a limited version […]

item.title: Uber promises member exclusives as Uber One passes $1B run-rate
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
Uber plans to deliver more perks to Uber One members, like member-exclusive events, in a bid to gain more revenue through subscriptions.  “You will see more member-exclusives coming up where members have exclusive access to events and experiences, which will kind of surprise and delight our members,” said Uber chief financial officer Prashanth Mahendra-Rajah Wednesday […]

item.description:

item.title: Controversial drone company Xtend leans into defense with new $40 million round
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Close to a decade ago, brothers Aviv and Matteo Shapira co-founded a company, Replay, that created a video format for 360-degree replays — the sorts of replays that have become part and parcel of major sports broadcasts. item.title: Mycocycle uses mushrooms to upcycle old tires and construction waste
item.dc:creator: Henry Pickavet
item.description:
Usually, when something starts to rot, it gets pitched in the trash. But Joanne Rodriguez wants to turn the concept of rot on its head by growing fungus on trash to turn it into something better. “We train mushrooms to eat trash and create renewable, bio-based raw materials,” she told TechCrunch. item.title: UK challenger bank Monzo nabs another $190M as US expansion beckons
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description:
Monzo has raised another £150 million ($190 million), as the challenger bank looks to expand its presence internationally — particularly in the U.S. The new round comes just two months after Monzo raised £340 million ($425 million), meaning the London-based company has now raised north of $610 million in 2024, and $1.5 billion since its inception nine […]
